thread.title: Report: Former Syracuse, Celtics player Fab Melo dies at 26
thread.title_full: Report: Former Syracuse, Celtics player Fab Melo dies at 26

title: Report: Former Syracuse, Celtics player Fab Melo dies at 26
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Report: Former Syracuse, Celtics player Fab Melo dies at 26 Melo was found dead in his home, Brazilian Military Police confirmed to ESPN. Post to Facebook Report: Former Syracuse, Celtics player Fab Melo dies at 26 Melo was found dead in his home, Brazilian Military Police confirmed to ESPN.  //usat.ly/2l29vkN   Report: Former Syracuse, Celtics player Fab Melo dies at 26 USA TODAY Sports 10:54 p.m. ET Feb. 11, 2017 Former Syracuse player Fab Melo has died, according to Brazilian Military Police. (Photo: Debby Wong, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Fab Melo, the 22nd overall pick in the 2012 NBA draft, has died at the age of 26, according to a report by ESPN . 
Citing Brazilian Military Police, the report says that Melo was found dead Saturday in his Juiz de Fora home. 
Melo spent two seasons at Syracuse, where he averaged 4.9 points and 3.8 rebounds per game. During his sophomore season the Orange went 34-3 reached the Elite Eight. However, Melo, who was Big East Defensive Player of the Year, was suspended for the NCAA tournament for an academic issue . He had previously been suspended three games during the season. 
A later NCAA investigation in the academic issue led to the school vacating all its wins from the season and self-imposing a ban on its NCAA tournament participation in 2015. 
Melo declared for the NBA draft after the season was selected by the Boston Celtics. He appeared in just six NBA games in 2012-13 season. Melo was traded to the Memphis Grizzlies in 2013 and later signed by the Dallas Mavericks, but did not appear in a game for either team. 
"I'm very sorry to hear about the passing of Fab Melo," Syracuse coach Jim Boeheim said in a statement on Twitter. "He was a kind, genuine person who was committed to doing his best while he was at Syracuse. Our staff and his teammates were fortunate to have had the opportunity to know Fab. Our thoughts and prayers are with his family." I'm very sorry to hear about the passing of Fab Melo. He was a kind, genuine person who was committed to doing his best while he was at ... — Jim Boeheim (@therealboeheim) February 12, 2017 Syracuse. Our staff and his teammates were fortunate to have had the opportunity to know Fab. Our thoughts and prayers are with his family." — Jim Boeheim (@therealboeheim) February 12, 2017 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE NEVER MISS OUT Sports Stay in the know and in the zone, 7 days a week, with scores, analysis, and in-depth features and commentary. We're sorry.
